Instruction: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease 12 muffin wells or line them with paper liners.

In a large bowl, combine flour, baking powder, salt, and nutmeg by whisking. In another bowl, mix together 1/2 cup sugar and shortening until creamy. Add the egg and mix in. Gradually stir in the flour mixture with the shortening mixture, alternating with milk. Mix thoroughly. Spoon the batter into the prepared muffin cups.
Bake in the preheated oven for 20 to 25 minutes. While the muffins are baking, mix together 1/2 cup sugar and 1 teaspoon cinnamon.

Remove muffins from the oven and the muffin pan. Quickly dip the tops of the muffins into the melted margarine, followed by the sugar and cinnamon mixture. Repeat this process with each muffin until all tops are coated. Serve warm.
